description.narrative: The biodiversity of Brazilian multiple-use forest landscapes of high conservation value is conserved through a strengthened sustainable use management framework for non-timber forest products (NTFP) and agro-forestry systems (AFS)
independent political entity

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: Governance and capacity building framework for upscaling best practices for BD sustainable management and production

Improved institutional capacities of EMBRAPA to effectively influence the planning implementation monitoring and mainstreaming of NTFP and AFS into production practices at the landscape level as measured by a of increase in the capacity scorecard see Annex 6

comment.narrative: 20 increase

The Project is in process of being incorporated into Embrapas monitoring system IDEARE The incorporation will to promote the increasing of responsibilityinstitutional ownership of Embrapa as well as increase the scope of the projects results The project is expected to be fully placed into the system by December 2016
The mapping of increased Embrapa capacity will be measured by the scorecard capacity from PY2 onwards after the insertion of the project into the IDEARE platform
Inception workshop concluded and actions undertook for the conclusion of the regional workplans plans of each CT in the six focal areas of the project
Communication consultancy contracting in progress The action a crosscutting issue but expected to provide visibility and increased recognition of Embrapas actions inside and outside the institution
20 increase

description.narrative: Increased knowhow of extensionists on NTFP and ASF as measured by the number that obtain at least 70 score in evaluations of project training on NTFPAFS

comment.narrative: At least 540 obtain over 70

Survey with the CTs regarding training demands is in progress The survey aims providing subsidies for the formalization of Agreement Letters andor contracting of consultants for the training of peasants extension and students in SAF and NTFP

description.narrative: Number of Citizenship Territories andor CUs that adopt AFS for restoration of degraded lands as a strategy for planning and implementation of the Forest Code

comment.narrative: At least 1 in each biome

Methodology draft carried out by researchers from Embrapa and project technical advisors for the evaluation of agroforestry systems SAFs Determination of the typology is under development The methodology will serve as a basis for the development of researches to be conducted in the second semester of 2016 directly by Embrapa researchers or consultants

description.narrative: Number of NTFP species that have differentiated minimum prices PGPMBio in each biome

comment.narrative: To be determined in PY1
At least one species per biome

Baseline determined Cerrado Pequi 1 specie Caatinga Umbu e Babaçu 2 species Amazônia Açaí Castanha e Andiroba 3 species
The Project intends to carry out a survey on the cost of production with the aim of establishing a parameter of the current situation in each biome in order to propose an update of minimum price within the PGMBio Minimum Price Guarantee Program for Sociobiodiversity Products of the Federal Government
Consultancy ToR prepared for collecting information on the cost of production to subsidize the minimum price in three biomes Contracting will be held in the second half of 2016

description.narrative: Market and financial frameworks for upscaling for NTFP and AFS production in highconservation value forest landscapes
Increase in percentage of producers that access financing eg credits grants for NTFP and AFS production and management subject to environmental criteria

comment.narrative: ToR elaborated and in process of approval for preparation of manuscripts related to opportunities and barriers to credit and finance
ToR elaborated and in process of approval for preparation of manuscripts related to opportunities and barriers to credit and finance

description.narrative: Percentage of public purchases of BD products by key government programmes PAA PNAE and PGPMBio1 based on NTFP and AFS best practices

comment.narrative: At least 20

ToR elaborated for contracting an expert on commercialization of biodiversity products A survey of the current information in each CT is in progress and after completion a consultant is planned be hired In addition the project is expecting political definition about the continuity of the government programs for food purchases which have suffered severe cuts after the new Government took office
At least 20

ToR elaborated for contracting an expert on commercialization of biodiversity products A survey of the current information in each CT is in progress and after completion a consultant is planned be hired In addition the project is expecting political definition about the continuity of the government programs for food purchases which have suffered severe cuts after the new Government took office

description.narrative: Percentage of increase in the share of BD products in family incomes

comment.narrative: Existing data in literature are not reliable andor do not correspond to intervention areas Baseline to be determined in PY1

Results of the consultancy will provide inputs to the definition of baselines of indicators 5 and 11 Result Level as well as to the formulation of public policies focusing on SAF and NTFP since there is not official data available

description.narrative: Degree of improvement in production chains of 5 species for increased market value and access

comment.narrative: Value chains for Brazil nut and acai exist but are not adequately structured

Brazil nut sanitary quality of nut production
Açai sanitary quality of pulp production
Umbu quality of processed pulp
Pequi oil production cost

Regional workshops held and regional work plans completed Regional workshops were held with the purpose of established common graund for development appropriation and dissemination of the project into the territories as well as developing partnerships with the aim of implementing the activities planned inside the citizenship territories in the second half of 2016
In order to measure the projects area of action in the three biomes negotiations are underway to define mapping methodologies with Embrapa Monitoring CTs and local partners
Particularly in regard to the Sustainable Development Reserve RDS of Alto Rio Pardo the project is working to support a diagnosis for the creation of the RDS management plan The Plan will establish safeguards for sustainable use of biodiversity within the reserve

Particularly in regard to the Sustainable Development Reserve RDS of Alto Rio Pardo the project is working to support a diagnosis for the creation of the RDS management plan The Plan will establish safeguards for sustainable use of biodiversity within the reserve

description.narrative: Conservation and production security of 5 key species enhanced through maintaining population growth rates stable or increasing measured through a population asymmetry index and size class distribution fit to the J reverse distribution model Brazil nut acai Amazon pequi araticum Cerrado and umbu Caatinga

comment.narrative: To be determined in PY12 through sample plots to be established in each CT

Index gt 0
Inferred from population structure distribution models and the impact of anthropic variables see Biological Monitoring Plan in Annex 5 for details
Elaboration of baseline in progress Initial actions were undertaken for the establishment of sample plots of four 4 species Brazilian nut açaí pequi and soursop in 2 biomes Amazon and Cerrado
